title: Laptop Suggestions
body:
Looking for suggestions for a laptop under $1000 to mainly play league on - also what are the new macs like to play league on??

Currently have a HP Dv7 Pavillion - it has ok specs but LOL doesnt run very well - dont know why this occurs - any help appreciated

replies.body: Macs are great, just expect the 0 fps and 20 fps during fights, and don't forget the 3 year loading time! Recommend 10/10!

LOOOL

But Mac desktops are good though, even though the mouses only have one button.
I personally use a mac, but thats because i have no alternative

You always have a choice! 
Never say never.

The most important thing in a laptop for running games is the graphics card. According to what I looked up, your HP Dv7 Pavillion has Intel integrated graphics. (Intel graphics=bad, integrated=bad.)

This site lists heaps of GPUs with FPS benches for different resolutions, etc: [link](http://www.notebookcheck.net/Computer-Games-on-Laptop-Graphics-Cards.13849.0.html)

Have a look around and find something you like and then check its GPU against that site. (Ctrl + F search, or manually navigate the graph.)

The MacBook and MacBook Pro 13" both use Intel integrated graphics. The 15" has dedicated graphics but will run you upwards of $2k... it should run league fine, but unless you want a Mac for other reasons it's not worth it. A gaming laptop would be far cheaper and get the job done.

Also... I prefer League on Windows as opposed to OS X.

Apple products are known to be overpriced for their value. If you're going to want a gaming laptop, don't buy a Macbook, their hardware isn't really optimal and I think Macbooks are way more fussy to modify than Microsoft laptops.

Well generally I'd suggest not to do that, but if you have to I've heard good things about Lenovo thinkpads. Think it's just over 1000, but it's one of the better ones for gaming.
There's an example, but they seem to have plenty of customization options if you want to sacrifice HDD for a better processor.
http://shopap.lenovo.com/nz/en/laptops/thinkpad/edge-series/e550/?sb=:000000AD:00000912:#tab-customize

This is purely from what I've heard though, I don't have experience with them.

Yer im not really looking for a mac, i just use my old mac atm for uni notes etc - i prefer pc as well, just want a reliable laptop that runs leauge at max settings easily, thats not slow. Proboably around 13-15inch screen under 1000 bucks
